poem:
Title: The Dow Descends

A stoic echo on the trading floor,
Ripples of slides and stumbles, like dominoes.
Low throbs the pulse of Eurozone's score,
Unemployment is shushed by the bleak bellows. 

Stocks slump in Wall Street where ambitions cluster,
Boeing, once gallant, brought to its knees,
In the stratosphere of hope, a dwindling luster,
As loose screws falter in the industry's breeze.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Eurozone unemployment hits joint record low; UK election could prompt bond turmoil – business live 2.57pm GMT Dow Jones in red as Boeing falls again Stocks are losing ground on Wall Street in early trading. The Dow Jones industrial average has shed 269 points, or 0.7%, down to 37,413 points. Boeing is the top faller, down 1.8%, as the crisis at the aeroplane-maker continues. Overnight, both Alaska Airlines and United reported they had found loose". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
